H0.text: Heat is transferred from the vibrating cardboard cone of a radio speaker to the surrounding air, producing sound.

H1.text: Current is transferred by the vibrating cardboard cone of a radio speaker to the air around it, producing the sound.

H2.text: Wave motion is transferred to the air around the cardboard cone of a radio speaker when it vibrates, producing the sound.

H3.text: Magnetic force is transferred by the vibrating cardboard cone of a radio speaker to the surrounding air, producing sound.

A4.text: The sound source creates vibrations in the surrounding medium.

A5.text: In physics, sound is a vibration that propagates as an acoustic wave through a transmission medium such as a gas, liquid or solid.
